cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 450 miles southwest of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-northeast, forecast to cross the Florida Big Bend Monday, then sweep northeastward across coastal Georgia/South Carolina and exit into the Atlantic while paralleling the Southeast coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Altamaha Sound GA to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Altamaha Sound GA southward to Sebastian Inlet FL (includes Port of Brunswick, GA)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast, Florida peninsula, Georgia coast, South Carolina coast, and portions of North Carolina coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible late Monday night into Tuesday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible at high tide along the Georgia coast; significant (>3 ft) surge is not indicated
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated 8-inch totals possible across eastern Georgia; flash-flooding risk at the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible across southern Georgia as the storm core passes; dangerous seas and strong rip currents in and near the harbor entrance
